page.title: 07STREETS AND BUILDINGS-v.
page.content: West St.ctd. From West St. Park St. leads South to the cul-de-sacs of London End and Sunny side where several old buildings and a row of traditional shoe-makers cottages overlook the river valley. Amongst these old buildings is the former Work- house now converted into a modern home, and the first of Messrs Barkers factories. The original fire station has been demolished in Park St. to make way for a Car Park.There are two farms in this area. Traditional industry is reflected in street names:e.g.Skin Lane,Hide Park(!).
